description: Blend of goose +â€Ž gander.  The oldest known use is by Drayton (1622).

entries.meaning: A merganser, Mergus merganser, of the northern hemisphere. They eat fish and are common on lakes and rivers.
examples: As they above the rest were Lords of Earth and Ayre.
The Gossander with them, my goodly Fennes doe show
His head as Ebon blacke, the rest as white as Snow,
